entry.title: Revert "wayland: Support insets in configure-sync model"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 9e7c9522a3abc08ba4e695c16b34bc3f04815723.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the cause of a test failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/test-analysis/b/5716289576239104



Sample build with failed test: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8755506940616469697

Affected test(s):

[ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/WebAppFrameToolbarBrowserTest_AdditionalWindowingControls.MaximizeAndRestoreWindowWithApi](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest:browser_tests%2FWebAppFrameToolbarBrowserTest_AdditionalWindowingControls.MaximizeAndRestoreWindowWithApi?q=VHash%3A7faed43ff17d1e72)



If this is a false positive, please report it at http://b.corp.google.com/createIssue?component=1199205&description=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fci.chromium.org%2Fui%2Fp%2Fchromium%2Fbisection%2Ftest-analysis%2Fb%2F5716289576239104&format=PLAIN&priority=P3&title=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F5289676&type=BUG



Original change's description:

> wayland: Support insets in configure-sync model

>

> This CL supports decoration insets in PlatformWindowDelegate::State and

> carry the data through the state transition similarly to other data

> such as bounds_dip.

>

> This will align the behavior within the configure-sync model.

>

entry.title: [bfcache] Refactor mojo structs for BFCache blockers
entry.content:
This CL creates a mojo struct that represents a source location. The goal is to have only two states when we manage source locations: 1. source location exists 2. no source location at all. Having a struct for source location allows us to make a source location itself nullable (avoiding having optional fields inside) and limit the possible cases to only the two.



Here are the specific changes in this CL:

- Created a new mojom file and defined a struct for source location there.

- BFCache-related structs now use the source location struct in common.



Bug: 324201881

Change-Id: I4061ad708010f895416e5881d46c16ba8a3251d6

entry.title: [Nearby Presence] Override and Implement OnConnectionResult() callback
entry.content:
Context: go/cros-nearby-presence-np-nc-interop



This CL implements `OnConnectionResult()` for NearbyConnectionsManager.

When a Presence client uses `RequestConnectionV3()` on a Presence

device, it can then accept or reject the connection. If it accepts using

`AcceptV3()`, Nearby Connections will return a status through this

`OnConnectionResult()` callback, which populates the `connections_v3_`

map.



Additionally, this implements `OnDisconnected()` which works similarly

to the v1 variant.



Test: unit tests added

Fixed: b/321729748, b/321729753

Change-Id: I862a3dd2ee3152a854c851146cb9910bdfc7e14e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5255222

Reviewed-by: Juliet Lévesque

Commit-Queue: Crisrael Lucero

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Reviewed-by: Ryan Hansberry

entry.title: [WebNN][CrOS]: Enable DeepLab V3 for semantic segmentation
entry.content:
All operators required by DeepLab V3 [1] has been implemented except

Resample2d operator, this CL converts it to TfLite builtin resize bilinear and nearest neighbor for interpolation mode.



This CL also implements Clamp operator with RELU_N1_TO_1 and RELU6

builtin tflite operator, other range of clamp are not supported.



[1] http://download.tensorflow.org/models/deeplabv3_mnv2_pascal_trainval_2018_01_29.tar.gz

entry.title: [Bluetooth] Implement IsExtendedAdvertisementAvailable in BlueZ
entry.content:
This implements IsExtendedAdvertisementAvailable in BlueZ which allows

applications to determine whether the underlying Bluetooth controller

supports extended advertising features.



One thing that might worth noting is that the application has to call

IsExtendedAdvertisementAvailable after the LEAdvertisingManger is ready.

Otherwise the wrong value might return. This can be fixed by

implementing the notification function to handle the property changed.

entry.title: Fix how `Text::splitText` notifies the change to `LayoutText`
entry.content:
This patch fixes `Text::splitText`:

* To notify the correct `TextDiffRange` to `LayoutText`.

* Not to notify when setting `SetForceReattachLayoutTree`.



The latter is done by extracting a shared logic with

`Text::UpdateTextLayoutObject`, allowing `LayoutText` to use

the information while optimizing.

entry.title: [Office upload] Log metrics when cannot get Drive relative path
entry.content:
Previously when trying to open a Drive url and the relative path

couldn't be retrieved, no metrics were logged. This means there would

be leakage in the TaskResult and the OpenErrors for Drive.



Add a new enum OfficeDriveOpenErrors::kCannotGetRelativePath to handle

this end state.

entry.title: Files app: let NATIVE_PATH show Fusebox volumes
entry.content:
A new comment in filtered_volume_manager.ts discusses 3 volume

categories: nat, fsf or fwf. There's also the 3-valued AllowedPaths enum

and the 3-valued context in which isAllowedVolume is called: (1) with

the #fuse-box-debug flag enabled, (2) without, in lacros and (3)

without, in ash.



We can write out a 3x3 table where the rows are AllowedPaths enum values

and the columns are (1) debug, (2) lacros and (3) ash. Before this

commit, it looked like this:



. debug lacros ash

ANY_PATH nat,fsf,fwf nat,fwf nat,fsf

ANY_PATH_OR_URL nat,fsf,fwf nat,fwf nat,fsf

NATIVE_PATH nat nat,fwf nat



This commit leaves the ANY_PATH and ANY_PATH_OR_URL rows unchanged, but

the NATIVE_PATH row now shows fwf volumes more often. The before/after

diff for this commit is:



. debug lacros ash

NATIVE_PATH:bef nat nat,fwf nat

NATIVE_PATH:aft nat,fwf nat,fwf nat,fwf



In particular, ODFS (OneDrive File System) is an FSP (File System

Provider) volume which is not nat. When showing a browser's "Save As"

dialog, this passes NATIVE_PATH and so, before this commit, "Save As" in

ash would not show any ODFS volume at all. After this commit "Save As"

in ash shows the fwf-ODFS volume (the Fusebox flavor).



After this commit, people can now point the ChromeOS browser at a JPEG

image and "Save As" directly to their ODFS volume, just like how they

could already do so to their Drive volume.



Drive is Google Drive, not Microsoft OneDrive, two similarly named but

different cloud products. Drive has its own VolumeType.DRIVE enum value

and is nat. ODFS (a Google-authored FSP extension for Microsoft's

OneDrive) is VolumeType.PROVIDED (like any other FSP) and comes in fsf

and fwf variants (like any other FSP).



A future commit might simplify further, changing that bottom row to

match the other two rows (every row becomes "nat,fsf,fwf nat,fwf

nat,fsf"), so that the AllowedPaths enum value doesn't matter at all.

But having "in ash" (so prefer fsf) trump NATIVE_PATH (so use fwf, i.e.

kernel-visible) is a bigger, riskier change, so not part of this commit.

entry.title: Remove URLLoaderThrottle::Delegate::RestartWithURLResetAndFlags
entry.content:
Remove `defer` from

`URLLoaderThrottle::BeforeWillProcessResponse` and

`URLLoaderThrottle::BeforeWillRedirectRequest`

as they are not used.

This removes `DEFERRED_BEFORE_RESPONSE` as well.



Remove `URLLoaderThrottle::Delegate::RestartWithURLResetAndFlags`,

and instead signal a restart by setting `RestartWithURLReset` to true

in `BeforeWillProcessResponse` or `BeforeWillRedirectRequest`,

because and to clarify `RestartWithURLReset` can be set only

synchronously within these methods.



Remove `pending_restart_flags_`.

(`RestartWithURLResetAndFlags()` was always called with 0)



Remove `throttle_will_start_original_url_`

(always true when `RestartWithURLResetNow()` is called)



Remove `has_pending_restart_`, and use `RestartWithURLReset` local

variables instead, because Before* methods can no longer defer the

loading and thus restarting is processed immediately.

entry.title: CCA: Refactor PTZ control logic
entry.content:
Digital zoom is planned to be controlled using Mojo, which is different

from the existing way to control PTZ using MediaStream API. To handle

both ways of controlling PTZ using the same UI, we add PTZController

interface to let both approaches implement.



In this CL, we create an interface PTZController, and moves the existing

control to a new class MediaStreamPTZController.

entry.title: Revert "[Default Nav Transition] Implement AnimationManager"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 249bf160e0b67010d1ddbd074ecb2df75dfa859b.



Reason for revert: Likely culprit of test failures (see bug)



Original change's description:

> [Default Nav Transition] Implement AnimationManager

>

> Full impl of the AnimationManager interface for mainframe cross-doc

> navigations only. Only the transformational animations are included

> (i.e., layer moving animations). Does not include scrim or cross-fade

> animations. Subframes, same-doc and cross-origin server redirects are

> TODOs.

>

> We use a new hook OnDidNavigate() to observe the finishing of a request

> (committed successfully), and use DidFinishNavigation() to observe the

> non-committed requests (204/205/Download, replaced or cancelled). Using

> a new hook because the OnRenderWidgetHostViewSwapped() timing is too

> late [1].

>

> Edge cases:

> - Another navigation commits while the user is still swiping across the

> screen: synchronously destroy the impl_.

> - Another navigation cancels our navigation and our navigation isn't

> pending-commit. Play the cancel animation to bring back the active

> page.

> - Our navigation cancels other navigations. No action.

> - With NavigationQueuing, a previously pending navigation has committed

> before our navigation commits. No action.

> - Our navigation has committed (so the animation manager is displaying

> the invoke animation / waiting for the new renderer to submit a frame

> / displaying the cross-fade animation) while another navigation

> commits. This can happen while navigation queuing or with a client

> redirect. In this case we synchronously destroy the impl_.

>

> [1]: OnRenderWidgetHostViewSwapped happens during

> RFHManager::CommitPending, and CommitPending happens after

> WCI::DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit [2]. At

> DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit, we will reset the LocalSurfaceId on the

> old View. Because we need to clone the old View's visual state, the

> notification needs to be placed before the LocalSurfaceId is reset.

> [2]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigator.cc;drc=d3dcc876aec63f37b5c9b38281e7485ff24b7bd3;l=511

>

>

> Bug: 1509888

> Change-Id: I8390910b2c43da45655052998d1369dc4b5ba1e7

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5122651

> Commit-Queue: William Liu

> Reviewed-by: Khushal Sagar

> Reviewed-by: Rakina Zata Amni

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1262714}

entry.title: Add PickerKeyEventHandler and basic plumbing for keyboard navigation.
entry.content:
For Picker keyboard navigation, we'd like to allow users to easily type

and modify their search query, as well as easily navigate and select

search results.



To do this, we plan to keep focus on the Picker search field and

override TextfieldController::HandleKeyEvent to forward keyboard

navigation events (e.g. arrow keys) to other Picker views where

necessary. (We also plan to "highlight" and draw fake focus indicators

onto these views so that they appear focused to the user, similar to

the behaviour of omnibox and app list search results.)



As a starting point, this CL adds PickerKeyEventHandler and basic

plumbing of the key events to relevant Picker views. For now, only the

enter key is handled and it just selects the first search result.

Further key event handling will be added in followups.



Bug: b:322900302, b:325192974

entry.title: frame/wayland: Set immersive only when changed on Lacros
entry.content:
This CL introduces `last_requested_immersive_status_` which preseves the

latest request on immersive state and sends wayland message only when

the coming request is different from the last one.



This moves the logic from ImmersiveModeControllerChromeos::SetEnabled

to WaylandToplevelWindow for Lacros so that immersive state changes

can always be caught even if it does not go through

ImmersiveModeControllerChromeos.



This CL also removes `previous_request_enabled_` check from Ash since

Ash always runs synchronously.



Bug: b:325124209, b:321184550

entry.title: Prevent calling GIF callbacks if they do not match the current query
entry.content:
If you type at the right speed, you can trigger a situation where the

destructed `EndpointFetcher`'s request wasn't fully completed yet (?),

calling the callback _after_ the request was supposedly cancelled.

This was hitting a `LOG(DFATAL)` in the search controller.



Catch this in the client itself so the search controller does not need

extra code.

entry.title: [omnibox] Fixes reporting zero-suggest metrics in searchboxstats.
entry.content:
crrev.com/c/5280536 had a subtle bug where the internal ACResult's

session data was being swapped with the published ACResult in Sync and

LastAsync autocomplete passes. This resulted in that data to be lost

from the internal ACResult and not be set on the ACMatches in

ACController::UpdateSearchboxStats(). The unit tests also failed to

detect that. This CL fixes that bug, renames ACResult::Swap() to

ACResult::SwapMatchesWith(), reorganizes the code and adjusts the

comments for clarity, and improves the unit tests.



crrev.com/c/5286774 also had a subtle bug where zero_prefix_enabled

was being set to true in ACController::UpdateSearchboxStats() which

is reached when zero-prefix suggestions are shown, not zero-prefix

suggestions could've been shown as it is expected by this metric to

report. This CL also fixes that by setting zero_prefix_enabled earlier

in ACController::Start().



This CL also enables the feature by default to facilitate merging this

change (1 CL to merge instead of 2) to m123.



Bug: 1307142

Change-Id: I0d53f429ff8b39aa5b4257bbf4219e729d6822ed

entry.title: media/gpu/chromeos: Change MailboxVideoConverter interface
entry.content:
This changes the MailboxVideoConverter interface to accept

FrameResources. This is done in an effort to split up a large CL that

changed all usage of VideoFrame to FrameResource across the decoders,

frame pools, and MailboxVideoConverter.



MailboxVideoFrameConverter is entangled with PlatformVideoFramePool

through the GetOriginalFrameCB. That callback cannot be changed without

also changing the frame pool. As a result, GetOriginalFrameCB still

returns a pointer to a VideoFrame, and much of the

MailboxVideoFrameConverter is still VideoFrame-based. The intention is

to change GetOriginalFrameCB to return a pointer to a FrameResource when

the PlatformVideoFramePool gets migrated to use FrameResource natively.



Bug: b:277581596

Test: video.Play.*hw* tests pass on Volteer.

Test: media_unittests pass on Volteer.

entry.title: [wptrunner] Dump `*-{expected,actual}.png` for expected reftest failures
entry.content:
`results.html` relies on the presence of `{expected,actual}_*` artifacts

to classify and render failed tests [0]. However, wptrunner doesn't

create `{expected,actual}_image` for expected (print) reftest failures

because, by default, it only dumps `reftest_screenshots` for unexpected

results [1, 2]. Match `run_web_tests.py` by dumping screenshots on `fail`

instead.



[0]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/tools/blinkpy/web_tests/results.html;l=1368-1392;drc=778ca1e76945fc7be6a726f948c0374b51371a10;bpv=0;bpt=0

[1]: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/blob/e7ef6d08/tools/wptrunner/wptrunner/wptcommandline.py#L693

[2]: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/blob/e7ef6d08/tools/wptrunner/wptrunner/executors/base.py#L569-L573



Fixed: 40947531

Test: ./run_{web,wpt}_tests.py external/wpt/infrastructure/reftest/reftest_match_fail.html

Test: At least `*-actual.png` in `layout-test-results/`

Test: `results.html` shows one "image failure", no regressions

Change-Id: I4f552f7dad0423e9c3c51fde68baee29f85fde51

entry.title: media/gpu/V4L2StatefulVD: Reduce queue sizes and report those
entry.content:
This CL reduces the encoded chunks queue size (called "OUTPUT" queue)

and then NotifyEstimatedMaxDecodeRequests() those.



Tested locally on Hana with Tast video.PlaybackPerf 1080p60 sequences

and as expected the Renderer-side decode latency decreases, e.g.



h264 300 ms -> 216 ms

vp8 179 ms -> 124 ms

vp9 201 ms -> 126 ms



with the # of dropped frames, driver decode delay, power consumption

etc staying similar. Trogdor, the other V4L2StatefulVD also improves

a bit (by ~10ms each) but is less drastic.



Bug: b:318426433

entry.title: snap-groups: Move split view resizing to `SplitViewDivider`
entry.content:
This CL is a pure refactor:

- Moves `FinishWindowResizing()` and `GetEndDragLocationInScreen()`

from SplitViewController to SplitViewDivider

- Modifies `SplitViewController::EndResizeWithDividerImpl()` to

instead call `SplitViewDivider::MaybeEndResizing()`. SplitViewDivider

will do the correct order by calling the client in `OnResizeEnding()`

and `FinishWindowResizing()`



- Modifies SplitViewController to implement virtual methods in

LayoutDividerController that are needed by SplitViewDivider



This is needed to fix resizing in Snap Groups.



Bug: b/309856199

entry.title: cbor: make `DiagnosticWriter` a little smarter.
entry.content:
The DiagnosticWriter converts CBOR structures into debugging strings. It

approximately caps the size of the returned strings to avoid huge

messages causing problems. But when a CBOR structure contains a huge

bytestring, that can immediately hit the limit and cause all the

rest of the structure to be ignored.



This change causes any bytestring that, when hex-encoded, is > 87.5% of

the max output length, or which pushes the debugging string over the

limit, to be replaced by a placeholder: "(x bytes)".



This isn't perfect, it's still a greedy algorithm, but it's a modest

debugging improvement when there are large bytestrings in a message.



Change-Id: I3a812d179a0f353336f86cab612ae517d9b572cf

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5310565

entry.content:
On navigation, ActiveTabPermissionGranter clears tab specific

permissions in the browser and notifies only the main process.

Additionally, ScriptInjectionTracker doesn’t include tab permissions

when computing script matching.



This causes renderer to inject an extension script after renavigating

to a site previously granted one-time tab permission (with a cross

origin navigation in the middle).



This CL fixes this by:

- Notifying all active renderers when clearing tab permissions

- Adding tab permissions to ScriptInjectionTracker script matching



Bug: 324455951

Change-Id: I048c8a3d314c3525a1da9ac1dd773b0852923002

entry.title: Revert "Drm: Always specify GAMMA_LUT"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 584e032f1c6e43a2e6fa45f0e80cbe739b69ca0d.



Reason for revert: breaks MTK b/326134132



Breaks MTK because MTK has GAMMA_LUT broken. Historically we haven't

been using this path, and so it may be broken on other devices.



We're going to have to explicitly allow-list GAMMA_LUT and

DEGAMMA_LUT, and assume they are broken on all devices (except

for Chromecast).



Original change's description:

> Drm: Always specify GAMMA_LUT

>

> The last time something like this was tried, we set both DEGAMMA_LUT

> and GAMMA_LUT. The DEGAMMA_LUT parameter is unreliable to the point

> of being unusable. Closer examination of all paths that use it reveals

> that they are all disabled.

>

> This is not obviously the case for GAMMA_LUT, which is used by other

> paths.

>

> The GAMMA_LUT will need to be changed to implement night light and

> ambient adjustment on platforms that have a functional DEGAMMA_LUT

> (platforms where the CTM is applied in linear space) and on

> platforms that don't have a CTM.

>

> Bug: 1505062

> Change-Id: I52d02b2ce624d0bb3c3f79e6ef36cd10e46a06e2

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5277072

entry.title: Ensure window goes to NORMAL state after resize-toggled
entry.content:
This CL ensures that a window goes to NORMAL state after it’s

resize-toggled.

Previously, we used `widget->Restore()` but it sets

`aura::client::kIsRestoringKey` during the operation, which makes ash

move the window to any state other than NORMAL depending on the window

state history.

So we want to explicitly trigger the state change to NORMAL. Please note

that this doesn’t “bypass” the client-controlled transition model.

Setting a kShowStateKey just notifies ash to emit WM_EVENT and that’s

handled asynchronously with ARC++ as usual.



BUG=b:325409397

BUG=b:322137433

BUG=b:325399059

TEST=ResizeUtilTest



Change-Id: Ica4b3629f6bd9960a22198f67e6794edd5d25dd1

plane. We can promote a quad to overlay as long as its transform to

root results in a flat and affine mapping for the x/y plane.

entry.title: [exo] Fix broken drags in zcr_extended_drag_v1
entry.content:
Currently there exists a race condition in ExtendedDragSource that

results in incorrectly positioned windows during a window dragging

session.



ExtendedDragSource::pointer_location_ must be maintained in screen

coordinates. This data member is updated in two locations



- ExtendedDragSource::OnToplevelWindowDragStarted()

- ExtendedDragSource::OnToplevelWindowDragEvent()



The race occurs as follows



1. The drag begins with ash's DragDropController::StartDragAndDrop(),

which calls ExtendedDragSource::OnToplevelWindowDragStarted().



- This correctly sets pointer_location_ in screen coordinates [1]



- In Exo the drag is deferred until the client responds by

sending the zcr_extended_drag_source_v1.drag request [2]



2. Before the zcr_extended_drag_source_v1.drag request is received by

exo the system processes an ash/system mouse event that is

routed to ExtendedDragSource::OnToplevelWindowDragEvent() to

continue the drag [3]



3. Since zcr_extended_drag_source_v1.drag has not yet been received,

ExtendedDragSource::OnToplevelWindowDragEvent() early returns [4]



- However before the early return pointer_location_ is updated

to the LocatedEvent's coordinates and this is not updated to

screen coordinates (it remains in target window coordinates)



4. zcr_extended_drag_source_v1.drag request is received by Exo and

ExtendedDragSource::StartDrag() is called



- This converts pointer_location_ into parent-local coordinates

and starts the drag [5]



- However in step 3 this was incorrectly set in parent-local

coordinates, resulting in pointer_location_in_parent being

incorrect and often completely off-screen



This results in browser windows appearing to jump off-screen

immediately after tab drag has started.



This race is currently only visible on external displays as screen

coordinates will effectively be 1:1 with parent-local coordinates on

the primary display.



The fix is to set pointer_location_ in OnToplevelWindowDragEvent()

only when drag has started to avoid situations where the coordinates

are not corrected to screen coordinates.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/exo/extended_drag_source.cc;l=229;drc=c571efbef3ecfe66613d524ff39c58e25d18548c



[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/exo/extended_drag_source.cc;l=240;drc=c571efbef3ecfe66613d524ff39c58e25d18548c



[3] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/drag_drop/drag_drop_controller.cc;l=409;drc=f4a00cc248dd2dc8ec8759fb51620d47b5114090



[4] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/exo/extended_drag_source.cc;l=262;drc=c571efbef3ecfe66613d524ff39c58e25d18548c



[5] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/exo/extended_drag_source.cc;l=339;drc=c571efbef3ecfe66613d524ff39c58e25d18548c



Bug: 40946538, 295555784

make the number of lines quite long. Snackbar doesn't support fine-

adding ellipses to a string token is tricky. Adding in simple logic

to ellipsize longer folder titles.

entry.title: Rename shadow root "type" to "mode" to match spec
entry.content:
The spec calls this the "mode":



https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#interface-shadowroot



but in code we previously called it the "type", which causes some

confusion. This CL mechanically renames from "type" to "mode".



This includes:

- s/ShadowRootType/ShadowRootMode

- s/GetType()/GetMode()

- s/type/mode (in shadow_root.*)



Note that the ShadowRootType concept in renderer/core/inspector

was left alone, since that has to do with devtools protocol.

events, the performance looks pretty similar between the two. I think

impact of layout work since DeprecatedLayoutImmediately will be

removed.

entry.title: [User Education] Rework idle detection and session logic.
entry.content:
This change addresses a few issues with the previous implementation of

the User Education sesion logic:



1. Waking from sleep to locked state followed by unlocking could

previously result in no new session, even if there was a large gap

from the previous active time. This appears to have been a problem on

Mac and probably ChromeOS to a lesser extent.

2. If no browser window is open or active, the application is treated

as not active, even if the computer is active. Without an active

window previously IPH would not be shown, but a "session" could

remain open even if the user was not using Chrome. This could happen

on Mac and ChromeOS specifically.

3. If an update is received where the last known active time for the

system is too far in the past, it no longer updates the most recent

active time for Chrome, and therefore subsequent updates can start

a new session; this could sporadically result in similar issues to

(1) above.



In addition, some APIs have been simplified/clarified, and others

received improved documentation.



An entirely new suite of unit tests has been written to test the

situations described above, with better separation between tests with

a mock idle policy (designed to test the functionality of the session

manager) and teststhat target the idle policy itself.



Bug: b/325482201

Change-Id: I2ede4cc51eef5c819539e042d3b43855ed29de2d

entry.title: [Extensions] Add tbarzic (back) as an owner of lock_screen_data
entry.content:
tbarzic was removed as an owner of the lock_screen_data API

in crrev.com/ff135a4120f0e3c722551f0d4f40d58cfef7c7fc with the

reasoning that tbarzic was already an owner in

//extensions/browser/api (a parent directory). However, having

individual owners of APIs is important as it indicates who the

primary person who owns that API is, even if they are an owner

of a parent (just how an owner in //OWNERS may appear in lower

directories, and we wouldn't want to assign an owner //OWNERS

for a bug in a directory with more proximal owners).



Add tbarzic back as an owner in

//extensions/browser/lock_screen_data/OWNERS



Bug: None

entry.title: content: make disable-jit actually disable high-tier v8 compilers
entry.content:
As of r1247811, there is a new site setting, which is entitled "Sites

can use the V8 optimizer". The actual behavior of that setting, though,

is that it disables *all* use of JIT in the renderer, which means

disabling WebAssembly support altogether.



Since M122 is going to stable imminently, this change is the minimal fix

to avoid breaking an existing web API (wasm): the site setting's

behavior is changed to match what the settings page describes. Since

this setting is *also* tied to enterprise policies:



* DefaultJavaScriptJitSetting

* JavaScriptJitAllowedForSites

* JavaScriptJitBlockedForSites



This change will cause a behavior change for users of those policies:

webassembly will be enabled for sites for which it would previously have

been disabled.



Fixed: 325974501

Bug: 325992828

and lorgnette will filter the scanner list depending on the status of

that flag. The legacy Scan App should always use true while the new

documentscan API should use false.

called from the new API. Ensure the flag is set appropriately for these

two calls.
